data.title: DiagnosticCollection.set(entries: [Uri, Diagnostic[]][]) overload doesn't replace all diagnostics
data.body: It keep adding them to the document.

data.title: Question: Is there any way to trigger a "refresh" of a CodeLensProvider?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `Version 1.5.0-insider (1.5.0-insider)` 538cd9ded5a471fbb20920f01eff9c8df4b83ee9
- OS Version: `OS X El Capitan Version 10.11.6 (15G31)`

I am trying to figure out a way to trigger a refresh (recalc) of a CodeLensProvider from inside an extension. Currently the CodeLensProvider automatically is refreshed on edits, but I want to have it refreshed after the document is saved (since I want to provide an updated git blame).

I have tried just disposing the CodeLensProvider but that causes the document to jump around far too drastically. Is there another way?

Thanks!

data.title: Only shortcut in commandService.ts if the command is a core command
Tasks have different encoding than shell, breaks build task
data.body:
I have a fairly complex build task using grunt, which breaks when I try to use Tasks. However it works fine, when I use the Integrated Terminal. 

I get the following error:

```
Running "concurrent:buildTemplates" (concurrent) task
    Warning: Error: Invalid US-ASCII character "\xC3"
            on line 2 of original/scss/settings/_mixins.scss
            from line 3 of original/scss/main.scss
      Use --trace for backtrace. Use --force to continue.
```

Which is due to a `ü` in a comment. So I'm guessing it has something to do with the encoding, but I'm not sure what to do.

data.title: The 'x' button to close a tab doesn't always work
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1

VSCode seemingly randomly forgets how to close tabs, furiously clicking the 'x' will eventually close the tab. There are no lockups/freezes when this happens, just the 'x' click being ignored (aside from animating on click).

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open lots of files
2. Start closing them
3. Notice that although the X animates on press, not all tabs are closed
4. If all the tabs closed first time, go to step 1.

data.title: Integrated terminal should remember scroll position
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.5.0-insider (538cd9ded5a471fbb20920f01eff9c8df4b83ee9, 2016-09-05T08:31:20.203Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal or start debugger and open debug window
2. Have enough output so there is a scroll
3. Have terminal (or debug console) continue to output stuff (for terminal eg. `while true; do echo "hi"; sleep 1; done`)
4. Scroll up because you want to read or copy something
5. Problem: As soon as new data comes - both windows are scrolled down to the bottom - they should only auto scroll to bottom if user was at the bottom of the window - otherwise scroll position should not change

data.title: 'debugger' on first line - stop event received before initilized
I cannot start “javascript” debugger in Visual Studio Code (probably, because installed HPC)
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1849690/18247082/eb06a558-7378-11e6-8296-7ae3e5b35b08.png)
- OS Version: windows7

Steps to Reproduce:

Create folder with app.js file (with several javascript lines).
Create default launch.json
Run debugger. Visual Studio Code doesn't start debugger (seems, tries to execute node.exe from HPC package) DEBUG CONSOLE output:

> node --debug-brk=37183 --nolazy app.js Node Commands
> 
> Syntax: node {operator} [options] [arguments]
> 
> Parameters: /? or /help - Display this help message. list - List nodes or node history or the cluster listcores - List cores on the cluster view - View properties of a node online - Set nodes or node to online state offline - Set nodes or node to offline state pause - Pause node [deprecated] resume - Resume node [deprecated]
> 
> For more information about HPC command-line tools, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=120724.

launch.json content: 

```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/app.js",
            "stopOnEntry": false,
            "args": [],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "preLaunchTask": null,
            "runtimeExecutable": null,
            "runtimeArgs": [
                "--nolazy"
            ],
            "env": {
                "NODE_ENV": "development"
            },
            "externalConsole": false,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null
        },
        {
            "name": "Attach",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "port": 5858,
            "address": "localhost",
            "restart": false,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null,
            "localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "remoteRoot": null
        },
        {
            "name": "Attach to Process",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "attach",
            "processId": "${command.PickProcess}",
            "port": 5858,
            "sourceMaps": false,
            "outDir": null
        }
    ]
}
```

The question published in stackoverflow (http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39314669/i-cannot-start-javascript-debugger-in-visual-studio-code-probably-because-in).

data.title: Typescript definitions not found when comparing changes on working tree
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0
- OS Version: Win10 April 2016

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3494407/18244063/65aeeb46-735e-11e6-98ed-ee47c28034b3.PNG)

When I open the changes of a .tsx file from GIT toolbox (Ctrl+Shift+G)  VSCode reports a lot of TypeScript errors. It seems like it cannot find file with typescript definitions.

However, when I open the same file from explorer (Ctrl+Shift+E) no errors are reported. 

What's even stranger, when I open changes of similar .tsx file in the same directory or any other .tsx file, no errors are reported, unlike the first file. I don't know what's so special about the first one.

(es)

data.title: [folding] collapse block comment shortcut

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When writing a lot of documentation pr. method, and for each variant when overloading methods, you end up with a tonne of green comment blocks and hardly readable code after a just a short while.

I would love a shortcut that collapses all multiline comments in the editor.

data.title: Running tests from command line crash

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10

We have tests running fine on AppVeyor, just by doing this:

``` shell
npm install
npm run vscode:prepublish
node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/test
```

Everything works just great! However, I want to run the same on my local machine (I'm trying to see if I can get coverage reports, so it'll need a lot of faffing around) but I get this:

``` text
> node ./node_modules/vscode/bin/test

### VS Code Extension Test Run ###
Current working directory: M:\Coding\Applications\Dart-Code
Running extension tests: M:\Coding\Applications\Dart-Code\.vscode-test\Code M:\Coding\Applications\Dart-Code\out\test --extensionDevelopmentPath=M:\Coding\Applications\Dart-Code --extensionTestsPath=M:\Coding\Applications\Dart-Code\out\test

[1096:9060:0904/171747:VERBOSE1:crash_service.cc(142)] window handle is 00170492
```

I'm not really sure where to start debugging. Is this expected to work? (I presume so, given it works on AppVeyor?)

There is preLaunchTask already which runs a task right before debugging, it would be cool also having a `postDebugTask` which would run a task when finishing debugging.

Users could then provide a custom start server and stop server task for example.

VSCode version: 1.4.0

This is required by standardjs.com guidelines, but is not possible at the moment.

Example: `function myFunc () {`

data.title: Is there a list of all stable commands we can call?
data.body:
In the help for `hide` on a `TextEditor` it says:

``` text
@deprecated **This method is deprecated.**
Use the command 'workbench.action.closeActiveEditor' instead.
```

However `closeActiveEditor` is not listed on the [Complex Commands API](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api-commands) page. Is this just an oversight, or is that page not a full list of commands we're allowed to call?

data.title: Support for file links

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4
- OS Version: Windows 10

It would be nice addition to add files as links from outside workspace (I think it's possible in standard VS).

I wish to reuse some files between two workspaces in following dir sturcture:
- workspace 1
  - files
  - links to files from ../shared
- workspace 2
  - files
  - links to files from ../shared
- shared
  - files
